content.html:
Highlight of the week: heard from several people in response to my post on friction in indie web connection ????

Looking forward to: making this blood orange olive oil cake

Stuff I did:

  • 7.75 hours writing — I committed to my accountability buddy that I would make a decision this week and I regret that commitment ???? but I have been dithering over this for months/ years depending on how you look at it
  • 45 minutes business development aka dragged myself over to LinkedIn and posted about a project, then sent invites to connect with a few people I’ve worked with recently — I begrudgingly endeavor to remind people I exist once or twice a year ????
  • 4.25 hours working on approach and budget for a proposal ???? Not due for a few weeks but I’d rather just get it done
  • The next stage of my music library cleanup: listening to every song I don’t recognize — my husband said “why are you torturing yourself like this?!” ???? I had a momentary shock when I discovered that OneDrive had completely lost an entire folder of new music (I’d moved it around and it must not have synced), so I had to re-download it from Amazon and Bandcamp ????
  • Deconstructed the chair I’d ordered (didn’t have the right tool ????), got it packed up and trekked it downtown — barely fit in the car so we had to tie the hatch down over it, but I’m good at knots and it’s only a mile to FedEx — all told took like two hours ????‍???? Now I have to figure out a new way to get a new chair — husband says not another refurbished chair because that was a gigantic pain ????
  • Connected with support at my webhost to resolve IndieAuth getting blocked by my server security (I have had so many issues with Mod_Security on my site ????)… did not work so I have to try again ????
  • Ran a full backup of my web hosting, then removed files for domains I no longer own because I’d been approaching the storage limit — then I went through all my inactive WordPress sites and uninstalled plugins that aren’t necessary
  • Reorganized my seasonal clothes and found some more winter clothes I’d forgotten about ????
  • Working on the next set of posts for my series but the order keeps shifting — hoping to make progress over the long weekend
  • Played games with my sister
  • Met up with a friend I hadn’t seen since summer for a walk, but then bailed on my usual weekly walk

Dinners:

  • Mushroom and leek quiche with pre-made crust
  • Chickpea and spinach curry (didn’t turn out great this time) + rice + mango chutney + flatbread + ginger beer
  • Creamy tortellini soup — fine but probably won’t make again — I used milk because I didn’t have cream (which would have been better) and only had 16oz of tortellini and did actually miss those remaining 3oz it called for
  • Mexican takeout — veggie burrito
  • Mac and cheese from a box with butternut squash mashed in, roasted red peppers, and smoked salmon
  • Taco Bell black bean crunchwrap
  • Tater tot nachos (inspiration)

Reading:

  • Bought and reread Dark Class by Michelle Diener
  • Started reading Alien Desire by Melody Beckett, Meditations for Mortals by Oliver Burkeman, and Oral Tradition and the Internet: Pathways of the Mind by John Miles Foley

Words I looked up / concepts I learned:

  • lithophane
  • meliorism
  • obelisk (biology)

Choice phrases:

Trying to make things what they are not can get you in a lot of trouble.

Cauliflower is not rice, for example. Codependency is not love.

— Annie Mueller

Pretty stuff I saw:

  • this brooch by Andrew Grima is funky cool (I’ve always been a pin person over necklaces or bracelets)
  • cool rock formations at Dovedale by Richard Carter

Website changes:

Finally got around to adding spoiler tags, and went back and fixed posts that contained them. (I decided that if I had made a note at the start that the entire review was spoilers, I wouldn’t spoiler tag the whole thing.) For some reason, on my site the label forces a line break instead of displaying inline, but it turns out that I have mostly put spoilers all together at the bottom of a post, so that worked out. I added them to my Style Guide so when I want to use them in a month and can’t remember how, I can copy it from there.

Venkatram let me know about an issue with my header that was caused by the scalloped border, so I took that off. (If you ever see anything wonky on my website, please shoot me an email because I only ever check it works in Firefox ????)

  • Updated several Big Question pages: Transforming Capitalism, Future of the Internet, Information Diet, Thinking Better, Writing Fiction
  • Updated my Start Here page, adding some recent favorites and whittling it down to 15 links

Nature notes:

  • Saw a hummingbird in the front yard drinking from the oregon grape!!!!
  • Dozens of little birds swarming the alder tree one morning — for bugs? seeds? who knows!

content.html:
Brief update on some links which I have updated:

  • All The Foods I Cannot Eat is a zine by Leoh Blooms which was made in 2017 and now has a proper home on the web.
  • On the Lab: there’s Spoiler Widget (with help from Tracy Durnell) & :root Color Properties Editor
  • My affirmations bot is back up and running and I’m very pleased about that: @affirmations@thisbot.day on Mastodon & thisbot.day on Bluesky.
  • YouTube is still where I am doing videos of CSS Battle Daily Targets. I’ve done a third of them and won’t stop until I’ve done all of them. I have done 192. I have 376 undone.
  • And at the Smorgasborg: Interviews with David Letterman & Douglas Adams.
    Plus a revamped copy of. The Power of the Powerless by Václav Havel.
    Lastly, I just put up a 2006 talk by Marc Sageman which I think about a lot.

Thanks for reading and clicking!

And I updated my tilde.club/~artlung page with the above, too.
content.text:
Brief update on some links which I have updated:
All The Foods I Cannot Eat is a zine by Leoh Blooms which was made in 2017 and now has a proper home on the web.
On the Lab: there’s Spoiler Widget (with help from Tracy Durnell) & :root Color Properties Editor
My affirmations bot is back up and running and I’m very pleased about that: @affirmations@thisbot.day on Mastodon & thisbot.day on Bluesky.
YouTube is still where I am doing videos of CSS Battle Daily Targets. I’ve done a third of them and won’t stop until I’ve done all of them. I have done 192. I have 376 undone.
And at the Smorgasborg: Interviews with David Letterman & Douglas Adams.
Plus a revamped copy of. The Power of the Powerless by Václav Havel.
Lastly, I just put up a 2006 talk by Marc Sageman which I think about a lot.
Thanks for reading and clicking!
And I updated my tilde.club/~artlung page with the above, too.

content.html:
new gloves kick ass against thorns, if a bit loose (I got large because so many reviews said they run small, I might try a pair of mediums)

Win of the week: adapted a post that’s been sitting on draft since last June into my entry for this month’s IndieWeb carnival ????

Looking forward to: walking with a friend I haven’t seen since summer next week

Stuff I did:

  • 5.75 hours consulting
  • 5 hours writing ???????????? wrote several alternate blurbs to help me decide between ending options to feel out what’s more marketable
  • make that late business license a $230 mistake — the city *also* charged me a late fee of $115 ????‍♀️
  • set up my new refurbished chair and I don’t like it ???? have initiated a return but need to deconstruct the chair first, and of course the instructions don’t work for the model I got ????
  • finally loaded my library into MusicBee and started doing more cleanup from there — having a different view makes it more readily apparent which artists I have Too Much of proportional to my liking of them
  • almost two hours of blackberry clearing… discovered I planted native roses in the gravel zone! I cut one and was like ???? waaiiiiitaminute those thorns don’t look the same… So now I need to pay closer attention and not just cut anything poky ????
  • spent an hour on the phone with five different insurance reps to get them to send me my birth control, my doctor hadn’t prescribed it as continuous use but told me I could take it that way… wound up needing to request a new prescription in the end ????
  • baked sourdough cream scones flavored with orange zest and dried cherries instead of vanilla (discovered my cranberries were best by 2023 ???? not risking it)
  • investigated Hardcover as a Goodreads alternative — it looks awesome but lacks custom statuses, so I have to decide if it’s worth giving up my “not interested” shelf to switch… it might be something I wait for them to develop a bit more
  • walked with two friends

Dinners:

  • Indian kathi roll takeout
  • chilaquiles + avocado
  • burger takeout: impossible burger with grilled onions and blue cheese
  • sausage sandwiches (the hot dog buns were moldy so we had to use hamburger buns ????)
  • fruit, cheese and crackers + scone
  • Thai takeout: stir fried eggplant + coconut fried tofu + rice
  • feta pasta bake again — used a local sheep feta and maybe overbaked it so it didn’t emulsify this time but still tasted fine — also used parsley instead of basil

Reading:

  • Read Hot Hex Boyfriend by Carly Bloom and Yield Under Great Persuasion by Alexandra Rowland
  • DNF’d Annihilation by Jeff Vandermeer (decided it was bad weird not good weird after 40 pages), The Four Dimensional Human by Laurence Scott (I like the metaphor of modem as portal but the writing wasn’t for me), Elements of Taste by Benjamin Everett (the idea of mapping flavors to taste profiles sounds neat but doesn’t bear out), and Salvaging Abby by N.J. Walters (bad guy is pure evil rapist type)

I was all excited to read Heavenly Tyrant, then I opened it up and (on Kindle) the first *three pages* are content warnings, starting with:

“Please beware that this book contains violence and abuse, body horror, mass murder, toxic relationship dynamics, discussions of reproductive coercion, allusions to childhood sexual abuse, and references to miscarriage, domestic violence, sexual assault, and suicide.”

Instant deflation. In the past year, I have noped out of three books I was excited about after the book opening to gnarly content warnings ????

Words I looked up / concepts I learned:

  • TIL chicle is a natural gum, and the name comes from Nahuatl!

Choice phrases:

  • “At their best, hypertext links are a hint of something, a foreshadowing. A document that bristles with them is like when a storyteller dangles a juicy detail in front of us, only to reconcile it much later in the tale.” — Dorian Taylor
  • “We are drowning in systems that strip the intentionality away from our social lives, and that offers us the illusion of community in place of the reality of it. Effort is what strengthens the synapses of our social networks.” — Ed Yong
  • “I want to feel the friction of civil disagreement: It’s through this friction that I understand what I believe.” — Alicia Kennedy

Pretty stuff I saw:

  • really nice design on this illustrated web essay about bats by Jay Perry
  • Sofa Cleopatra, designed by Geoffrey Harcourt
  • getting some Tonight, Tonight vibes from this painting by Jazzie Limon
  • album art for Rodion G.A. From the Archives (via)

New music I listened to:

  • Gunship – Ghost (feat. Power Glove)
  • DjNiraha – Pharoah Online Club ????

Website notes:

If you are interested in adding spoiler tags to your website, Joe’s got a writeup of a simple way how! Shoutout for talking through this at a Front-End Study Hall ???? …I still need to actually set it up here ????

Nature notes:

Heard a hummingbird calling in the front yard, then spotted it fly up, divebomb, and chase off another hummingbird

Spotted an orange-crowned warbler with its head glinting in the light as it bopped around our apple trees

Saw a hawk land in the Douglas-fir behind my house, but it was gone by the time I got the binos

before starting cleanup on the left side of the yard (Tuesday)that’s a new blackberry pile and there’s a bigger one out of frame — red flagging tape is marking the roses (Thursday) Progress!

before starting cleanup on the left side of the yard (Tuesday)that’s a new blackberry pile and there’s a bigger one out of frame — red flagging tape is marking the roses (Thursday) Progress!
